alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Gonzales; Karnes; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 11:08PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern DeWitt, Karnes, southwestern Gonzales and southeastern Wilson Counties through MIDNIGHT CST... At 1108 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Karnes City, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kenedy, Karnes City, Yorktown, Kosciusko, Nixon, Runge, Falls City, Smiley, Nordheim, Gillett, Cestohowa, Westhoff, Coy City, Cotton Patch, Choate, Meyersville, Ecleto, Helena, Pana Maria, and Gruenau. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
